lines.gurmukhi: igrigt kY rMg kml smyh bhu bnu bnu folY kauAw khw Dausvwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Giragit Kai Rang Kamal Samayh Bahu , Banu Banu Dolai Kauaa Kahaa Dhaousavaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A chameleon who changes the colour of its body so very often looks very much like the form of a lotus flower. But this insect-eating chameleon cannot be holding the merits of a lotus flower. A dead flesh-eating crow that flies here and there cannot reach

lines.gurmukhi: Gr Gr iPrq mMjwr Ahwr pwvY bys√çw ibsnI Anyk sqI n smwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Ghar Dhirat Manjaar Ahaar Paavai , Baysvaa Bisanee Anayk Satee N Samaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a male cat roams about various burrows and houses searching for food, and likewise a whore living life of several vices cannot reach out to a woman of truth, sincerity and virtues.

lines.gurmukhi: sr sr BRmq n imlq mrwl mwl jIv Gwq krq n monI bgu iDAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sar Sar Bhramat N Milat Maraal Maala , Jeev Ghaat Karat N Monee Bagu Dhiaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as wandering from pond to pond, one cannot find a flock of swans who live in lake Mansarover and an egret who kills living beings for food cannot be contemplating.

lines.gurmukhi: ibnu gurdyv syv Awn dyv syvk huie mwKI iqAwig cMdn durgMD AsQwn hY ]460]
lines.transliteration_english: Binu Gurdayv Sayv Aan Dayv Sayvak Hui , Maakhee Tiaagi Chandan Duragandh Asadaan Hai ?460?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, without the service of perfect Guru, if someone becomes a follower of any other god/goddess, it is like a fly who giving up the fragrance of sandalwood goes and sits on foul smelling filth.  (460)
